result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse Michael Cooper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: *DNA Sample pay Surcharge.  *Comply with all counseling recommended by agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse Michael Cooper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Jesse Michael Cooper in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he has had many discussions with Atty Gumz regarding resolution.  Atty Hendee states that in speaking to Atty Gumz there is resolution.  
Atty Hendee moves to amend to 946.41 Obstructing an Officer, Class A Misd. and states plea agreement.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Court amends the charge to 946.41 Obstructing an Officer, Class A Misd.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended charge.

Atty Gumz makes a statement to the court.  Atty Gumz files a statement from the defendant's provider that he would like the court to read.  Atty Gumz asks that the statement be sealed.
BY THE COURT:  Court will receive the statement into the record and it will be sealed.
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Withhold sentence; 12 months Probation with conditions:
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent

Defendant Jesse Michael Cooper in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that in speaking with Atty Gumz; the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today.  Atty Gumz agrees and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Atty Gumz states that the defendant will proceed with a Not Guilty plea today.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the Court.  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the information and waives its reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.

BY THE COURT:  Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.

  Return date scheduled for May 18, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Michael Cooper in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz waives time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived for the Prelim.
Set for Return.
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jesse Michael Cooper by video with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Jesse Michael Cooper in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Atty Gumz waives the reading of the criminal complaint.  Requests initial appearance be scheduled.  Atty Hendee requests signature bond with conditions.  Atty Gumz makes statement.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
